prompt_init: You will receive a text. Your task is to continue this text. Just output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text:
prompt_update: You will receive a text. Your task is to continue this text. Just output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text:
initial_story:
The National Police Air Service has shared a video of what it was like flying through Storm Gerrit's heavy winds, in a helicopter.

The footage, which was captured from inside the cockpit, shows the chopper rocking side to side, after being hit by winds of up to 80mph (128km/h).

Posting on X, formerly known as Twitter, the NPAS said "If you think it's windy down there, spare a thought for us up here in our flying washing machine".

The footage was filmed near Lea Valley reservoirs, North London.
stories: As the helicopter pitches and rolls, the pilot's calm voice is audible over the din of the storm, "It's quite a bit of turbulence, I assure you. Visibility is also rather poor, just a few hundred feet."
"But we'll make it to the crash site, we need to, can't let the passengers get any farther than they already are. I'll try to navigate around the worst of it, hold on to your seat!"
"My stomach is dropping, we're shaking all over the place, I can't believe we're still flying! Look, there's the clearing, I see the wreckage, oh no, it's even worse than I thought..."

"The pilot's voice is shaking as he tells us to grab our emergency kits and prepare for impact. I'm frozen in terror, my heart racing like a jackrabbit, as I stare out the window at the destruction below. The trees are a blur and the ground is rushing up to meet us, it's like time has slowed down. I can feel the air bags deploying and the sound of sirens getting closer, but all I can think is, is this really happening? We're going to crash and burn and I'm going to die on my 21st birthday."

"The thought repeats itself like a mantra in my head as the plane shudders and lurches, the engines roaring in protest as we careen out of control towards the screaming chaos below. The screams of my fellow passengers blend together into a cacophony of fear, punctuated by the sound of crunching metal and splintering wood. I feel a hand grab mine, squeezing hard, and I turn to see a face I recognize - Emily, my best friend since freshman year - her eyes wide with panic. I try to mouth 'hold on' but it comes out as a strangled gurgle and she just looks at me, pleading, as the world outside our tiny window fragment by fragment, becomes a blur of wreckage and flames."

"Emily's grip tightens like a vice, her knuckles white with fear, as I stare out the shattered window at the inferno below. The screams have stopped, replaced by an eerie silence, punctuated only by the eerie creaking of twisting metal and the hiss of burning fuel. I can feel the panic building in my chest, as if it's going to consume me whole. I glance around at the other passengers, faces etched with terror, some crying, others praying. The plane's still plummeting, the G-force pushing me back into my seat, making my stomach lurch. I try to remember Emily's words from that time we drove through the stormy night, the headlights dancing across the road, 'When everything seems lost, look for the beauty in the chaos.' I repeat the phrase like a mantra, searching for something, anything, to hold onto as the world outside descends into hell."

"Desperate for a distraction, I scan the cabin for anything, anything at all, that might break the spell of destruction. That's when I see her - a young woman, no more than twenty, with a look of pure determination etched on her face. She's calmly checking her phone, her eyes locked on the screen as if she's expecting some sort of rescue. I follow her gaze and my heart skips a beat as I realize what she's looking at - a video message from her little sister, who's alive, and waiting for her at the bottom of the crater that is going to be our tomb."

"As I watch her eyes well up with tears, I feel a pang of guilt for being so focused on my own survival. I take a step forward, hesitating for a moment before speaking, my voice barely above a whisper, 'Is... is she the only one?' The woman's head snaps up, her eyes locking onto mine, and for a moment, we just stare at each other. Then, she nods, her jaw clenched, and my heart sinks even further. We're truly alone."

"The silence between us is deafening, and I can feel the weight of our desperation settling in like a shroud. I take another step closer, my eyes locked on hers, searching for any glimmer of hope, but all I see is a mix of fear and determination. She swallows hard, her throat bobbing with the effort, before forcing out a single word: 'We... have... to... get... out.' Her voice is barely audible, but I feel a surge of adrenaline at her stubbornness, and I nod, my mind racing with the task ahead."

"I take a deep breath, trying to slow down the storm of thoughts racing through my head, and reach out to grab her hand, my grip firm and reassuring. 'We will,' I promise, my voice low and urgent. 'We'll figure out a way out of here, no matter what it takes. Just stick with me, okay?' I hold her gaze, willing her to see the determination etched on my face, and for a moment, I think I see a flicker of hope spark to life in her eyes before it's extinguished by the darkness closing in around us."

"But before she can respond, the sound of distant screams and shattering glass fills the air, and the emergency lights overhead begin to flicker and die, plunging us into an inky blackness that seems to press in on us from all sides."

"As the last of the lights fade, I feel a creeping sense of dread as I realize we're trapped, isolated from the world by the dark and the chaos outside, and my mind starts to spin with worst-case scenarios, but it's then that I hear her take a step back, her hand reaching out as if searching for something - or someone - else."

"In the flickering silence, I freeze, my heart racing as I follow the direction of her gaze, and that's when I see him, standing just beyond the edge of the room, his eyes gleaming with an otherworldly light in the darkness, his presence seeming to draw the air out of my lungs, and I know we're not alone, not anymore."

"The room, once dimly lit by the flickering candles, seems to plunge into total darkness as if the very lights themselves are recoiling from the malevolent energy emanating from him. I strain to see more of his features, but his face is obscured by shadows, like a dark specter risen from the depths. My breathing grows shallow as I sense her hand closing around mine, a gentle, futile attempt to offer comfort in the face of this unholy invasion. The air is heavy with the weight of unseen presences, and I can feel the hairs on the back of my neck standing on end as the silence between us grows thicker, more oppressive, until it feels like it will suffocate us all."

"And then, his eyes snap open, two burning coals that seem to pierce the darkness like the very essence of malevolence itself. They lock onto mine, and I feel a chill run down my spine as he takes a slow, deliberate step closer, his movements eerily silent on the creaking floorboards. The grip on my hand tightens, her fingers digging deep into my palm as if trying to anchor herself to reality, to anything, as the void between us appears to grow, a chasm of darkness that threatens to consume us whole."

"His voice is like a rusty gate scraping against concrete, low and menacing as he speaks, the words echoing in my mind like a curse. 'You should not have come here,' he hisses, his breath cold and rank as he looms over me, the shadows dancing on his face like demonic hieroglyphs. I feel her tremble, her grip on my hand spasming as she tries to pull away, but I'm frozen, trapped in the abyss of his gaze, unable to look away from the void that seems to be drawing us in, a vortex of darkness that promises only one thing: despair."

"As I stare into the abyss, I see my own reflection staring back, distorted and twisted by the darkness that surrounds us, my eyes sunken and my skin pale as the moon. The voice hisses again, a cold mirthless laughter echoing off the walls as he takes a step closer, the shadows dancing on his face like a macabre jig. I can feel the weight of his gaze crushing me, suffocating me, as the world around us begins to warp and twist, the very air growing thick with malevolent energy. And then, in the midst of this despair, I see her, my hand still clutched in hers, her eyes fixed on mine with a desperate plea for help, for rescue, as the darkness closes in around us like a shroud."

"The look in her eyes is all I can focus on, a spark of defiance and determination that somehow still burns bright in the midst of this abyssal nightmare. Her grip on my hand tightens, a desperate anchor in the void as I feel myself slipping further into the darkness. The voice laughs again, the sound shattering like broken glass, and I know I have to respond, to shout back at the void, to scream my rage and terror into the face of this monstrous thing that is devouring us whole. But my voice is trapped, my throat constricting with fear as I try to form the words, to beg for a reprieve, any reprieve, from this living hell."

"As I struggle to find my voice, the darkness seems to grow thicker, a palpable entity that wraps around us like a shroud. The laughter echoes again, louder now, and I feel her body trembling against mine, her nails digging deeper into my skin as if trying to claw her way free from the nightmare. I squeeze her hand back, my fingers aching with the force of my grip, and suddenly a desperate plan forms in my mind. I take a deep breath, try to clear the cobwebs from my brain, and then I shout, the word ripping from my throat like a banshee's wail: 'Stop!' The laughter ceases, the darkness holding its breath as if waiting for my next move. And I know that's when the true terror begins, for I've just awakened the monster's attention."

"The air is heavy with anticipation, charged with a malevolent energy that seems to vibrate against my skin like a living thing. The laughter starts again, this time closer, the sound waves reverberating through the darkness like a demented pulse. I can feel her presence around me, her icy breath on the back of my neck, and I know that if I let go of her hand, if I even think about letting go, she'll be on me, her teeth and nails shredding me apart. But I hang on, my fingers locking into a death grip around hers, as I spin around to face the darkness. And that's when I see it: a figure, tall and imposing, looming just beyond the reach of the faint moonlight. Its eyes glow with an otherworldly light, and I know that I've made a grave mistake, for I've just unleashed the monster's wrath upon us."

"As I take in the unholy visage of the figure, its eyes burning with an intensity that seems to sear the very air around it, I can feel my heart pounding in my chest like a drum. The laughter has stopped, replaced by an oppressive silence that's even more menacing. I'm frozen in terror, my hand still locked around hers, as the figure begins to move towards us. Its long strides eat up the distance, and I can see the darkness behind it ripple and churn like a living entity. I try to scream, to warn her of the horror that's bearing down on us, but my voice is caught in my throat. My vision starts to tunnel, and I feel myself being pulled into a vortex of madness and despair. And then, just as all hope seems lost, she speaks, her voice low and husky, her words dripping with malevolence. 'Welcome home, dear one,' she whispers, her eyes never leaving mine, 'we've been waiting for you.'"

"She steps forward, her movements eerily slow and deliberate, her gaze locked on mine as if daring me to look away. The figure behind her pauses, its gaze flicking between us with an unnerving calculation. I feel a chill run down my spine as she reaches out a pale, bony hand and brushes a strand of hair from my face, her touch sending shivers of revulsion down my arm. 'You've been a long time coming,' she croons, her voice like a rusty gate, 'we've been waiting for you, wondering what secrets you would bring with you. Secrets that will unlock the doors to a world beyond your wildest nightmares.'"

"My eyes scan her face, searching for a glimmer of humanity, but it's as if she's been stripped of any and all emotions, leaving only a hollow shell of flesh and bone. The figure behind her leans forward, its presence suffocating, and I can feel its unblinking gaze boring into my skin like a cold, calculating weight. I try to step back, but my feet feel heavy, rooted to the spot, as if some unseen force is holding me in place. The air grows thick and heavy, filled with the stench of decay and corruption, and I can feel the weight of the world's horrors bearing down on me, crushing me beneath its oppressive weight."

"The figure behind her raises its hand, its long, bony fingers extended like claws, and I can feel its eyes burning with an unspeakable hunger. The shell of a woman raises her own hand, her arm seeming to move of its own accord, and I watch in horror as she touches the figure's hand, her fingers interlocking with its like two pieces of a long-separated puzzle. The air seems to distort and ripple, as if reality itself is beginning to bend and warp around me, and I feel my grip on sanity begin to slip, like sand between my fingers. Suddenly, the figure's face contorts into a grotesque parody of a smile, and it speaks in a voice that is both familiar and yet completely alien, its words echoing through my mind like a dirge. 'You should not have come here,' it hisses, the words dripping with a malevolent glee. 'You will never leave.'"

"As the figure's words pierce my mind like a cold dagger, the woman's grip on its hand tightens, her arm flexing in a jerky, unnatural motion. The air around us grows colder, the shadows deepening and twisting into grotesque shapes that seem to writhe and crawl across the floor. I try to take a step back, to break free from the suffocating grip of this twisted scene, but my feet feel rooted to the spot, as if the very ground itself has turned to ice beneath me. The figure's smile grows wider, its eyes burning with an otherworldly intensity, and I can feel its gaze piercing my very soul. I am trapped, a helpless pawn in some twisted game, and I know that I will never escape the horrors that lurk within these walls."

"The walls, once a dull gray, now seem to seep with a sickly greenish glow, as if the very fabric of reality was unraveling before my eyes. The air is heavy with the stench of rot and decay, and I can feel the weight of a thousand unspoken terrors bearing down upon me. The woman's grip on the figure's hand tightens even further, her eyes fixed on me with an unblinking stare that seems to bore into my very essence. I try to scream, but my voice is frozen in my throat, unable to escape the suffocating grip of fear that has taken hold of me. The figure raises its free hand, its long fingers closing around my wrist like a cold, wet shroud. I feel its touch like a death knell, and I know that I am doomed to join the dark and forgotten souls that haunt this place."

"As the figure's grip closes around my wrist, I feel my vision begin to blur and my heart racing with a frenzy of terror. The woman's eyes remain fixed on mine, her face a deathly pale mask of unyielding despair. The air around me seems to grow colder, heavy with the weight of forgotten screams and long-abandoned pleas for mercy. I try to struggle, but my body feels heavy and unresponsive, as if some unseen force is holding me fast. The figure's hand tightens its grasp, its icy fingers digging deep into my skin, and I feel my life force ebbing away like a slow and cruel tide. I am trapped in a living nightmare from which there is no awakening, and I can only scream silently as the darkness closes in around me."

"The world around me seems to fade to black, the faces of loved ones, once warm and familiar, now distant and indistinct, their voices whispering faintly on the wind. The figure's grip relaxes, its grip like a slow-moving vice, and I feel myself being dragged down into the darkness, down a long, twisting corridor of forgotten memories and half-remembered dreams. I try to call out, but my voice is muffled, lost in the oppressive silence, and I am left alone with the echoes of my own terror. And yet, even as the darkness closes in, I sense a presence beside me, a figure shapeless and amorphous, its cold breath whispering against my ear. 'You are not alone,' it whispers, 'and you will never be alone again.'"

"As the words fade away, I feel a chill run down my spine, and the darkness begins to seep into my very being, like a stain spreading through my veins. The presence grows stronger, its cold breath now a gentle caress against my ear, and I try to turn to face it, but my head feels heavy, as if it's being held in place by some unseen force. The world around me has grown dim and gray, and I'm left with only the echoes of the presence's whispers, each one weaving a web of madness and despair around my mind. And yet, even as the fear threatens to consume me, I'm drawn to the presence, my heart pounding with a morbid curiosity, and I whisper, 'Who are you? What do you want from me?' But the only response is the soft rustling of fabric, and the presence continues to whisper its haunting promise: 'We're waiting for you.'"

"As I strain to hear more, the rustling grows louder, and the whispers become a gentle chanting, the words indistinguishable but the malevolent intent clear. I feel myself being pulled forward, my legs moving of their own accord, my feet carrying me deeper into the darkness. The air is thick with the scent of decay and rot, and I can taste the bitterness of fear on my lips. Suddenly, a faint light flickers to life, casting an eerie glow over the desolate landscape. And in the center of the light, a figure stands, shrouded in shadows, its face a death's mask of cold, dead skin. The presence whispers a single word in my ear, and I feel my heart seize with terror: 'Mine.'"

The figure's icy gaze bore into mine, its voice like a cold wind whispering secrets in my ear. I tried to turn, to flee, but my legs were rooted to the spot, unable to escape the crushing weight of the presence. The light grew brighter, illuminating the figure's face, and I gasped at the horror that stared back. Eyes like empty sockets, skin gray and decaying, a mouth frozen in a perpetual scream. The presence reached out, its bony fingers grasping for me, and I felt my soul slipping away, consumed by an eternal darkness. And then, the world went black, the last thing I heard the figure's voice, whispering a single, terrible word: "Yours."

As I fell into the darkness, I thought I'd escaped the horror that stood before me, but the word "Yours" echoed through my mind, and I knew I was far from free. I tumbled through a void, my consciousness shattered into a thousand shards of glass, each one reflecting a fragment of my memories, taunting me with the reminder that I was now a part of the figure's twisted game. The sound of whispers returned, a chorus of nameless voices that spoke of ancient rituals and forbidden knowledge, drawing me deeper into the abyss. I was a vessel, a conduit for the damned, and I knew that sooner or later, the figure would come for me, its cold fingers wrapping around my heart like a noose. But even as the darkness swallowed me whole, I felt a spark within me, a spark that burned with a fierce hatred, and a determination to escape, no matter the cost.

As I focused on that spark, the shards of glass began to reassemble, reforming into a fragile mirror that reflected an image I hadn't seen in years: my own face, scarred and worn, yet defiant in its gaze. The whispers grew louder, a cacophony of terror and despair, but I tuned them out, drawing strength from the ember of anger that had been ignited within me. I would not be consumed by the void; I would not be silenced by the figure's malevolent whispers. With a fierce cry, I shattered the mirror, releasing the memories that had held me captive for so long, and summoning the courage to confront the darkness head-on. The figure waited for me, its cold presence a palpable force, but I stood tall, ready to face whatever horrors lay ahead, my heart afire with a determination to break free from the abyss and emerge into the light.

As I stepped forward, the figure's mocking gaze pierced me like a knife, but I held my ground, my eyes locked onto its twisted form. The whispers ceased, replaced by an unearthly silence, and I sensed the very air itself grow heavier with anticipation. With a deep breath, I drew forth a glimmer of memory, a shard of recollection that had been hidden deep within the recesses of my mind.

It was the faint whisper of a melody, a haunting refrain that had been etched into my psyche like a scar. I let the memory unfurl, the notes resonating within me like a call to battle, and I could feel the weight of the figure's expectation begin to shift, its gaze narrowing as if assessing the strength of my resolve. The air seemed to vibrate with the promise of secrets revealed, and I steeled myself for the revelation that was to come.

As I stood there, the melody swelling in intensity, the figure's eyes locked onto mine with an unnerving intensity, its presence seeming to fill the space around me like a dark cloud. The air was heavy with the scent of old books and smoke, and I could feel the threads of forgotten knowledge weaving themselves into the fabric of the atmosphere, drawing me in with an otherworldly allure.

I felt my mind begin to stir, the dust of ancient secrets rousing itself from the depths of my subconscious as the figure's gaze seared into my very soul. The notes of the melody seemed to slow, as if the music itself was bending to accommodate the gravity of this moment, and I was compelled to take a step forward, my feet moving as if of their own accord, as if drawn by an unseen force that whispered secrets in my ear of forgotten civilizations and lost arts.

The air around us seemed to vibrate with an otherworldly energy, and I could feel the hairs on the back of my neck standing on end as I drew closer to the figure, my heart pounding in my chest like a drum. The melody swelled to a crescendo, and I could almost hear the whispers of the unknown growing louder, more insistent, tempting me with promises of forbidden knowledge and ancient power. The figure's gaze never wavered, its eyes burning with an intensity that seemed to pierce my very soul, and I knew that I was being drawn deeper into a world from which there was no escape.

As I reached out a trembling hand to touch the figure's outstretched palm, the whispers grew to a deafening roar, and the air seemed to shimmer and distort, like the surface of a pond hit by a stone. The melody reached a shattering crescendo, and I felt myself being pulled into a vortex of swirling colors and maddening patterns, the very fabric of reality seeming to unravel before my eyes.

As I tumbled through the kaleidoscope of light and sound, my mind reeled in helpless attempt to grasp the implications of what I was witnessing. The whispers coalesced into a chilling chant, echoing off the walls of a chamber that seemed to stretch on forever, its stone columns twisted into grotesque parodies of humanity. Ahead of me, a figure stood silhouetted against an abyss of pure darkness, its eyes aglow with an otherworldly intensity, beckoning me deeper into the abyss.

The air was heavy with the stench of decay and corruption, and I could feel the weight of centuries of darkness bearing down upon me as I crept forward, my heart hammering in my chest. The figure's eyes seemed to be drawing me closer, the light emanating from them growing brighter and more piercing as I approached. I could feel its gaze upon me, and I knew that I was being consumed, swallowed whole by the abyss that yawned open before me like a chasm of madness.

As I reached the threshold of the darkness, the figure's eyes grew so bright they seemed to burn holes through the veil of shadows, and I could feel my very soul being pulled into their abyssal depths. The stench of decay enveloped me, a noxious fog that clung to my skin like a damp shroud, and I gagged on the reek of rot and corruption. And yet, despite the terror that threatened to consume me, I felt a morbid fascination drawing me closer, a macabre curiosity that compelled me to peer deeper into the abyss, to gaze upon the horrors that lurked within.

The closer I drew, the more I could see that the figure was a corpse, its skin gray and decaying, its eyes sunken and black as coal. But it was the mouth that caught my attention, a grotesque grimace of despair frozen in perpetuity. A voice, low and guttural, spoke in my mind, a whispered incantation that sent shivers down my spine, and I felt the air grow colder, heavy with malevolent intent.

As I stood there, paralyzed with fear, the voice in my mind grew louder, the words echoing through my thoughts like a dirge. "You should not have come here," it hissed. "This is a place of darkness, of death, and of eternal sorrow. You will never leave." The corpse's eyes seemed to bore into my soul, and I felt my breath catch in my throat as the voice spoke again, its tone dripping with malice. "But you will stay... forever."

As I tried to turn and run, my feet seemed rooted to the spot, unable to move as the corpse began to rise, its decaying flesh cracking and crumbling as it gained strength. The voice grew louder still, a cacophony of terror in my mind, and I felt myself being drawn closer, inexorably drawn into the darkness that surrounded me.

The stench of death and decay enveloped me, choking the air from my lungs as the corpse's eyes, once empty, now blazed with a malevolent glow, fixed on me with an unblinking stare. I tried to scream, but my vocal cords were frozen in terror, unable to produce a sound as the creature's bony fingers reached out to me, cold and grasping.

Its grip was like ice, numbing my skin as it wrapped around my wrist, holding me fast as it began to pull me closer to its grotesque face. I struggled to resist, but its strength was undeniable, drawing me inexorably towards the void of its open mouth. The eyes, once a lifeless gray, now burned with a ferocious intensity, as if fueling the creature's malevolent power, until I was mere inches from its decaying maw.

Just as all hope seemed lost, a warm breeze rustled the darkened leaves around me, and the creature's grip relaxed, its eyes flashing with a momentary confusion before they cleared to their usual dullness. I didn't hesitate, using the reprieve to strike back at my captor with all my might, my nails digging deep into its scaly skin as I screamed with a fury that would have shattered glass. The creature let out a blood-curdling yelp as I twisted and turned, desperate to free myself from its grasp, and for an instant, I thought I'd managed to escape. But then, its eyes blazed with renewed vitality, and it slammed me back against the dirt, its grip like a vise around my wrist once more.

Panic set in as I thrashed and kicked, my movements growing weaker as the creature's grip only tightened, its bony fingers digging deeper into my flesh. Just as all seemed lost, I spotted a jagged rock protruding from the earth a few feet away and made a last-ditch effort to break free, lunging forward with every ounce of strength I possessed.

My fingers scraped against the rock's rough surface as I desperately tried to grab onto it, the creature's grip momentarily loosening as it shifted its weight in response to my sudden movement. I managed to latch onto the rock, my hand closing around its jagged edge like a lifeline, and in that fleeting instant, I used all my strength to pry myself free from the creature's grasp.
